title: 2 million black 'streaks' on Mars finally have an explanation, solving 50-year mystery
summary: A new analysis of data from NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter reveals that the majority of the Red Planet's dark "slope streaks" did not form as most researchers previously assumed.

title: Study reveals why the brain 'zones out' when you're exhausted
summary: Your sleep-deprived brain behaves as if you were about to nod off to sleep, even when you're awake.

title: British Churches Are Putting Their Faith in Heat Pumps
summary: Ancient buildings and old bones aren’t getting in the way of the transition.

title: New 'Dragon Hatchling' AI architecture modeled after the human brain could be a key step toward AGI, researchers claim
summary: Scientists say a new kind of AI could bridge the gap between current systems and machines that learn and think more like us.

title: AI Relationships Are on the Rise. A Divorce Boom Could Be Next
summary: Secret chatbot flings are creating new legal challenges for married couples when it comes to infidelity.

title: OpenAI’s Open-Weight Models Are Coming to the US Military
summary: The gpt-oss models are being tested for use on sensitive military computers. But some defense insiders say that OpenAI is still behind the competition.

title: KitchenAid Promo Code: 50% Off in November 2025
summary: Save on every purchase with top KitchenAid coupons from WIRED, including up to 50% off select countertop appliances.

title: Researching sustainable food production, with help from the cows
summary:
Nature, Published online: 13 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03056-x

body: Nature, Published online: 13 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03056-x Helena Kuoppala gets to work early to tend to a herd of dairy cows, exploring how dietary changes affect their health, milk yields and methane emissions.

summary:
Nature, Published online: 13 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03761-7

He helped to reveal the structure of life’s code, transformed science education and research, and remained a deeply controversial figure to the end.
body: Nature, Published online: 13 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03761-7 He helped to reveal the structure of life’s code, transformed science education and research, and remained a deeply controversial figure to the end.

title: Anthropic’s Claude Takes Control of a Robot Dog
summary: Anthropic believes AI models will increasingly reach into the physical world. To understand where things are headed, it asked Claude to program a quadruped.

title: 'Stranded' astronauts aboard Chinese space station are preparing to come home — but no date has been announced
summary: Three astronauts remain stuck on China's Tiangong space station after errant debris struck their return capsule last week. But their return vessel has already arrived, meaning a flight home will come sooner rather than later.

title: The AI Boom Is Fueling a Need for Speed in Chip Networking
summary: Next-gen networking tech, sometimes powered by light instead of electricity, is emerging as a critical piece of AI infrastructure.

title: Brain benefits of exercise come from the bloodstream — and they may be transferrable, mouse study finds
summary: Exercise strengthens both the body and the mind, and researchers are uncovering the molecular messengers that make the connection. The messengers can also be transferred from an active mouse to a sedentary one.

title: 13 Great Gifts for Mom: Ideas for the Best Mother (2025)
summary: From high-tech skin care to cool accessories, these are our favorite picks for the WIRED mom in your life.

title: New antivenom works against 17 dangerous African snake species, study suggests
summary: Scientists have developed a nanobody-based antivenom that neutralizes toxins from most African cobras, mambas and the rinkhals, which could offer safer, scalable protection beyond existing snakebite treatments.

title: How to Talk to ChatGPT for Free Inside WhatsApp (While You Still Can)
summary: Meta’s messaging app offers free access to the AI chatbot, but only until January 2026.

title: Exotic 'time crystals' could be used as memory in quantum computers, promising research finds
summary: Experiments show that a time crystal based on magnons can interact with mechanical waves without being destroyed.

title: James Webb telescope may have found the first stars in the universe, new study claims
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope may have discovered Population III stars, the universe's first generation of stars. They may tell us more about how galaxies form.

title: Is a 1768 painting the real birth of modern art?
summary: Why An Experiment on a Bird in the Air Pump was way ahead of its time

title: Tiny spiders that build giant 'puppet' decoys from disembodied prey discovered in Peru and Philippines
summary: Researchers have documented the strange antics of two tropical spider species that build giant, arachnid-shaped decoys out of silk, plant matter and prey remains in their webs.

title: This Is the Platform Google Claims Is Behind a 'Staggering’ Scam Text Operation
summary: Google is suing 25 people it alleges are behind a “relentless” scam text operation that uses a phishing-as-a-service platform called Lighthouse.

summary:

WGS data were used from 347,630 individuals with European ancestry in the UK Biobank to obtain high-precision estimates of coding and non-coding rare var…
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09720-6 WGS data were used from 347,630 individuals with European ancestry in the UK Biobank to obtain high-precision estimates of coding and non-coding rare variant heritability for 34 complex traits and diseases.

title: The contribution of rock strength to soil production
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09751-z

Findings from a tectonically active mountain range show that soil production is driven by bottom-up rock weakening rather than by soil thickness, challen…
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09751-z Findings from a tectonically active mountain range show that soil production is driven by bottom-up rock weakening rather than by soil thickness, challenging long-held top-down models.

title: Mortality impacts of rainfall and sea-level rise in a developing megacity
summary:
Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09730-4

High-resolution rainfall, tide and mortaility data are used to quantify the impact of rainfall and flooding on urban health in Mumbai, India, revealing a…
body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09730-4 High-resolution rainfall, tide and mortaility data are used to quantify the impact of rainfall and flooding on urban health in Mumbai, India, revealing an order-of-magnitude discrepency between observed and officially reported mortality impacts, with slum residents bearing most of the burden.

body: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09631-6 Aligning foundation models with human judgments enables them to more accurately approximate human behaviour and uncertainty across various levels of visual abstraction, while additionally improving their generalization performance.

title: ‘The Running Man’ Conjures a Dystopian Vision of America That’s Still Not as Bad as Reality

title: This Beats Pill Bluetooth Speaker Has Upgraded Features, and It’s Just $100

title: Newly discovered toads skip the tadpole stage and give birth to live 'toadlets'
summary: Three newly-identified toad species in Tanzania give birth to live young, skipping the frogspawn and tadpole stages — an "exceptionally rare" trait among toads and frogs.

title: Scientists create world's first microwave-powered computer chip — it's much faster and consumes less power than conventional CPUs
summary: A new kind of processor that uses microwaves can be used in future AI systems or in wireless communications, a new study shows.

title: Breakup of ancient supercontinent Nuna created 'incubators' for complex life, study finds
summary: Ancient supercontinent Nuna's breakup around 1.5 billion years ago set off a chain of events that made Earth more habitable, new research suggests.

title: Antibiotic found hiding in plain sight could treat dangerous infections, early study finds
summary: Scientists have discovered a never-before-seen antibiotic that shows promising in treating drug-resistant infections.

title: NASA’s ultraquiet supersonic 'flying swordfish' makes history with first test flight
summary: NASA and Lockheed Martin’s X-59 "quiet" supersonic plane flew for the first time in October. It’s a major step towards reintroducing commercial supersonic flight in the United States.

summary: Even without brains, creatures like jellyfish and sea anemones can learn from experience.

title: Some people love AI, others hate it. Here's why.
summary: Whether you love or hate AI has a lot to do with how your brain processes risk and trust.

title: Bizarre robotic chair concept looks like a crab and can carry you around the house — it can even help you into your car
summary: The compact robot enables people with limited mobility to navigate complicated environments where wheeled devices can't go.

title: باب التجارة الإلكترونية يستقطب رواد الأعمال في "بيبان 2025"
summary: يستقطب باب التجارة الإلكترونية في يومه الثاني من ملتقى بيبان 2025 عددا واسعا من رواد الأعمال والمستثمرين والخبراء في مجال التقنية والتجارة الرقمية، حيث يواصل تقديم منظومة متكاملة من الخدمات الرقمية والمزايا النوعية التي تمكن الزوار من تطوير مشاريعهم والارتقاء بها نحو أسواق التجارة الحديثة.

title: 47 شركة ناشئة تقدّم عروضها في اليوم الأول من بيبان 2025
summary: شهد اليوم الأول من فعاليات ملتقى "بيبان 2025"، الذي تنظّمه الهيئة العامة للمنشآت الصغيرة والمتوسطة "منشآت"، تقديم 47 شركة ناشئة عروضها أمام مستثمرين وجهات ممكنة على مسرح Pitching، ضمن خمس مجموعات احتضنتها مسرّعات محلية ودولية شملت Amad Tech، The Garage، BLOOSM، Orbit، و500 Global.
